author: NeverSayDieFan
title: Beckham's "dance" vs. J. Brown's "dance."
text: Posts: 2,219 Beckham's "dance" vs. J. Brown's "dance." BOTH seemed choreographed...BUT ONLY one got the 15-yd. excessice celebration penalty. Care to guess which one? Maybe ONLY players on the "sexy" NFL teams (ie; Giants, Cowboys, Steelers) are allowed to do it. Am I being too picky? Perhaps. It didn't cost us this time...Another game it might. The hypocrisy in the NFL STINKS! Mark A whole week to BASK!!! Location: Phoenix, AZ Posts: 11,057 Well OBJ's also came with an injured hammy, so I will take the 15 yard penalty. Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right, B, A, Select, Start Location: Phoenix, AZ Posts: 11,057 When Brown squatted, his hand hit the turf. I guess they interpreted that as going to the ground? Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk Up, Up, Down, Down, Left, Right, Left, Right, B, A, Select, Start You can dance if you want to. You just can't signal over a team mate and perform a choreographed dance routine. I like that CP jumped in his shizz about the the stupid penalty too. A master in the dark art of a high speed bludgeoning -Ron W Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak out and remove all doubt. Posts: 25,488 There definitely favoritism in the way they call the games. NFL should make all play reviewable to make it fair for all teams. Of course that would make the games too long. Still they can make it a point to the refs to even it out. It's actually good for the NFL when underdog teams win, it keeps it more interesting.
